review: I got this as a gift and was quite happy as I had considered purchasing myself.  I'm glad I didn't pay for this myself as I'm finding it pretty worthless.My plan was to use in conjunction with my laptop instead of a mobile device.-  Youtube.  Videos from youtube.com work flawlessly.-  Hulu.  I next tried Hulu.  Through a laptop -- you have to use the "cast from tab" (beta) function...... and it's terrible.  It's just unable to stream to laptop and then chromecast -- very slow, choppy, unwatchable.  The only "app" for Hulu requires:  1.  a HuluPlus account and 2.  It's only available for some mobile device operating systems.  You CANNOT do this through your laptop.... at all.You might as well just get the cable to connect your laptop to your TV and skip Chromecast.- Netflix.  I don't have an account... but I believe Netflix 's Chrome browser extension works in a laptop browser without needing a mobile app.  This extension acts successfully like the youtube method.  So if you have a netflix acount -- then it's probably worth it (but chances are you've already got a way to do this already).:o)

review: I love my chromecast.  I now have one on every tv in my home.  You can typically add $100 to any tv to get the smart functions.  With chromecast you can do it for $30.  Can't beat that.  Great for traveling.  Links to phone, tablet, laptop and desktop.  You can even mirror your desktop screen using the beta screening option.  Great value. Highly recommend.
